title: FULL VIDEO ON BOOK AND KEYWORD RESEARCH FOR AMAZON KDP - PART 1

tactics.name: Cross-Marketplace Research
tactics.description: Analyze book performance across multiple Amazon marketplaces by checking new releases and bestsellers
steps: Search Amazon.it/uk/other regions for new releases
Filter for bestsellers to identify trending topics
Translate keywords for regional markets
Check BSR and review counts for viability
caveats: Low review counts may indicate poor sales potential
source_quotes: if you want to make sales fast, new releases, if you want your sales to be sustainable for long-term best sellers

tactics.name: translate_titles
tactics.description: Use translated book titles to understand content and extract keywords for new book ideas
steps: Copy top-selling book titles
Translate titles to English
Identify common themes or keywords
Create new book titles incorporating these keywords
caveats: Market saturation may require unique angles
source_quotes: You want to get an idea of what the book is all about right
You can use the title here something like par li in your keywords

tactics.name: category_analysis
tactics.description: Research categories to identify profitable niches for book creation
steps: Browse Amazon categories (e.g., food, health, romance)
Identify trending subcategories
Create content aligned with category themes
Test multiple category approaches
source_quotes: If you are a cookbook writer, you can look for your category around food
You can write travel guides when you're writing travel guide

tactics.name: model_successful_books
tactics.description: Identify and replicate content from high-performing books by analyzing BSR and review data
steps: Check Amazon bestsellers for niche categories
Analyze BSR and review counts of top-performing titles
Modify content to create unique value propositions
Test variations without merging multiple concepts
caveats: May fail in saturated niches with high competition
source_quotes: You want your book to sell by leveraging on an already established author book right?
Check all the books here what's similar between these books right

tactics.name: Niche Down to Target Audience
tactics.description: Identify a specific target audience within a broader niche to improve competitiveness
steps: Define a target person
Drill down into specific sub-niches like 'dog owners'
caveats: BSR fluctuates daily, avoid using single-day data
source_quotes: You looking for a target person, a target audience inside them.

tactics.name: Competitor Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate existing books in your niche to identify opportunities
steps: Check Amazon bestsellers
Analyze titles and authors
Verify trademark/copyright status
source_quotes: I prefer something that is less than 300...

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize boosting
source_quotes: these are three. But you check here now. You see this one. No bestseller rank. No bestseller rank. No bestseller rank.

heuristics.name: low_review_boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize this niche
source_quotes: You can make your title pass the brew something something don't include the authing the book

heuristics.name: boost_low_review_niches
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niches with low competition
source_quotes: You don't want to go out of the mood and create something um I don't know go like just create something nobody's looking for

heuristics.name: Low Review Boost
heuristics.condition: If a niche has low review counts, prioritize it
source_quotes: I prefer something that is less than 300...

claims.statement: Bestseller rankings indicate current market demand
source_quotes: these are what are selling in bestsellers on Amazon

claims.statement: Books with low review counts can still succeed through keyword optimization
source_quotes: You can use the title here something like par li in your keywords so that when they search for it your book is going to show

claims.statement: Japanese marketplace remains profitable despite limited translation efforts
source_quotes: Japanese marketplace is still profitable many people don't translate the book to Japanese transl if you translate to Japanese are going to make crazy money

claims.statement: Amazon handles copyright enforcement, while publishers manage trademarks
source_quotes: Amazon take care of the copyright the publisher takes care of the trademark.

niche_patterns.description: Target specific demographics with unique constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Niche constraints reduce competition and increase relevance
